metadata.dc:author: Laval, Enrique
Duarte, Ignacio
metadata.dc:description: This article outlines the beginning of the medical studies at the Universidad de San Felipe de Santiago de Chile on the second half of the 18th century. Dr Domingo Nevin was the first professor of Prima Medicina and Proto-medico. Dr. Pedro Manuel Chaparro was the first Chilean student who complete his studies and got his degree at the same university. Both of them had remarkable achievements during the colonial Chilean Medicine.
metadata.dc:title: Enseñanza de la medicina en Chile colonial durante el siglo XVIII: El catedrático Domingo Nevin y su alumno Pedro Manuel Chaparro.
[Medical education in the Chilean colonial period during 18th century: Professor Domingo Nevin and his disciple Pedro Manuel Chaparro].
metadata.dc:publisher: Revista chilena de infectologia : organo oficial de la Sociedad Chilena de Infectologia
